Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies (83-69) begin the final homestand of the 2023 MLB regular season on Thursday night against the New York Mets (71-81).
The Phillies are fresh off an exciting series win over the Atlanta Braves.
The Mets roll into South Philadelphia winning three of their last four games, including a series win over Miami.
The Phillies enter the four-game series with thoughts of clinching a postseason berth at home.
The Phillies currently lead the NL Wild Card standings at +4.0 games including a +2.5-game lead over the Arizona Diamondbacks for the top NL Wild Card spot.
If the Postseason began today, the Phillies would host Arizona in the three-game National League Wild Card Series from Citizens Bank Park.
The final spots in the NL Wild Card race belong to the Chicago Cubs with the Miami Marlins lurking 0.5-games out of the final spot.
The Phillies magic number to clinch a 2023 MLB Postseason berth is six.
The Phillies magic number to earn the top NL Wild Card spot is 7.
